item.title: アーク・サーチの「ブラウズ・フォー・ミー」機能、検索結果の要約を掲載したカスタムウェブページを作るが、ウェブトラフィックと広告収入への懸念から反発に直面（Pranav Dixit/Engadget）
item.description:
Pranav Dixit / Engadget:
Arc Search's Browse for Me feature, which makes a custom web page with search result summaries, faces a backlash over concerns about web traffic and ad revenue  —  A new feature from the Arc browser puts search result summaries on a single web page that it creates on its own, cheating websites out of valuable traffic.

Sources: Sony Music Group has acquired half of Michael Jackson's publishing and recorded masters catalog for at least $600M  —  The deal, which is likely worth at least $600 million, includes half of the late star's publishing and recorded masters catalog.  —  In what could be the largest …

item.title: 多くのアウトレットは、プレミアムコンテンツに先行投資する資金がなく、ペイウォールが広告収入を圧迫していると見て、ハードサブスクリプションを放棄している（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Outlets are abandoning hard subscriptions, as many of them don't have the cushion for upfront spending on premium content and see paywalls throttling ad revenue  —  News companies are reversing course on hard subscriptions — once seen as a safer alternative to the volatile ad market …

item.title: 情報筋Netflix、Amazon、Paramountは寛大なオファーを出したが、WBDは$70M-$80Mを希望（Drew Taylor/The Wrap）。
item.description:
Drew Taylor / The Wrap:
Sources: WBD seems unlikely to sell or release Coyote vs. Acme, despite backlash; Netflix, Amazon, and Paramount made generous offers, but WBD wanted $70M-$80M  —  Warner was seeking $75 - $80 million but rejected offers from Netflix, Amazon and Paramount, insiders tell TheWrap

item.title: ローリング・ストーン』誌のノア・シャハトマンEICが、ガス・ウェナーCEOとの編集上の意見の相違を理由に、2年余の任期を終えて3月1日付で退任する（Benjamin Mullin/New York Times）。
item.description:
Benjamin Mullin / New York Times:
Rolling Stone EIC Noah Shachtman is stepping down on March 1 after over two years due to, a source says, editorial differences with CEO Gus Wenner  —  Noah Shachtman, the magazine's editor in chief since 2021, is resigning because of editorial differences with the chief executive Gus Wenner.

CoinDesk CEO Kevin Worth leaves in a major restructuring by new owner Bullish; Sara Stratoberdha, who ran business development for Bullish, will be the new CEO  —  Sara Stratoberdha replaces Kevin Worth, who has led CoinDesk since 2017.  —  Register Now  —  CoinDesk's longtime CEO Kevin Worth …

item.description:
Dawn Chmielewski / Reuters:
Disney is testing a contextual ad tool dubbed “magic words” for Disney+ and Hulu that uses AI to analyze scenes and identify contents, brands, images, and mood  —  Walt Disney (DIS.N) is harnessing artificial intelligence to power a new advertising tool that will help brands tailor …

item.title: AMCネットワークス、第4四半期の売上は前年同期比30％減の6億7900万ドル（予想6億7600万ドル）、ストリーミング契約者数は1％増の1140万人、米国での広告売上は前年同期比23％減の1億5800万ドル（Jennifer Maas/Variety
item.description:
Jennifer Maas / Variety:
AMC Networks reports Q4 revenue down 30% YoY to $679M, vs. $676M est., streaming subscribers up 1% to 11.4M, and US ad sales down 23% YoY to $158M  —  AMC Networks saw its streaming subscribers increase by 1% and its U.S. ad sales drop by 23% in the fourth quarter of 2023.

item.title: ホワイトハウス特派員協会は、サタデー・ナイト・ライブのコリン・ジョストが4月27日の年次晩餐会でエンターテイナーとして登場することを発表した（Megan Lebowitz/NBC News）。

The White House Correspondents' Association announces that Saturday Night Live's Colin Jost will be the featured entertainer at its annual dinner on April 27  —  The “Saturday Night Live” comedian has co-anchored “Weekend Update” since 2014.  —  WASHINGTON — “Saturday Night Live” …

Reuters:
Prince Harry settles the remainder of his phone-hacking lawsuit against Mirror Group Newspapers after it agreed to pay “substantial” damages and his legal costs  —  Prince Harry has settled the remainder of his lawsuit against Mirror Group Newspapers over phone-hacking …

item.title: OpenAIのCOOであるブラッド・ライトキャップは、サム・アルトマンによってアクセル・シュプリンガーとの契約締結を任された。
item.description:
Shirin Ghaffary / Bloomberg:
A profile of OpenAI COO Brad Lightcap, tasked by Sam Altman with striking a deal with Axel Springer, which may offer a road map for additional media deals  —  Brad Lightcap helped seal the startup's deal with publisher Axel Springer.  Now he's experimenting with the company's business model.

item.title: フットボール・アウトサイダーズ』、『メッセンジャー』、『NYT』でNFLを取材したジャーナリストが、彼らで働いた経験とスポーツメディアの現状を語る（マイク・タニアー/Defector）。
item.description:
Mike Tanier / Defector:
A journalist who covered the NFL for Football Outsiders, The Messenger, and The NYT talks about his experience working for them and the state of sports media  —  I covered the NFL for three media outlets in the last calendar year: Football Outsiders, The Messenger, and The New York Times.

item.title: ダークマネーのような構造的な問題について書くことの必要性と難しさ、SCOTUS報道の変化などについて、Slateのダリア・リスウィックとのQ&A（Kevin Lind/Columbia Journalism Review）。
item.description:
Kevin Lind / Columbia Journalism Review:
Q&A with Slate's Dahlia Lithwick on the necessity and the difficulty of writing about structural issues like dark money, the change in SCOTUS coverage, and more  —  In 1999, Dahlia Lithwick happened to be in Washington, DC, when the federal government was suing Microsoft over antitrust violations.

item.title: 米国の陪審団は、気候科学者マイケル・マンが研究データを操作したと主張する2人の右派ブロガーに対する名誉毀損訴訟で、100万ドル以上の損害賠償を命じた（Dino Grandoni/Washington Post）。
item.description:
Dino Grandoni / Washington Post:
A US jury awards climate scientist Michael Mann damages of $1M+ in his defamation suit against two right-wing bloggers claiming he manipulated his research data  —  The verdict comes amid heightened attacks on scientists working on climate change, vaccines and other issues

item.title: タッカー・カールソンとのインタビューで、プーチンはエヴァン・ガーシュコビッチを釈放することを「排除しない」と語ったが、WSJ記者がスパイ行為を行ったとの主張は崩していない（Corbin Bolies/The Daily Beast）。
item.description:
Corbin Bolies / The Daily Beast:
In an interview with Tucker Carlson, Putin says he would “not rule out” releasing Evan Gershkovich, but maintains claims the WSJ reporter committed espionage  —  “At the end of the day, it does not make any sense to keep him in prison in Russia,” Putin told Tucker Carlson during their two-hour interview.
